summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeGive BackOH. MY. GLAZE. Bubble‚Äôs Cosmic Silk is a ceramide-rich hydrating milky toner that‚Äôs clinically proven to hydrate, smooth, plump, and improve the radiance of your skin. It's not just another glaze‚Äîit's a milky, silky experience that will change your face forever.
details: DetailsBenefitsDeveloped with DermatologistsLeaves your skin looking glazed, dewy, and radiantClinically proven to hydrate, smooth, and plump your skinLayers well under makeupNon-comedogenicSuitable for repeat applicationGreat for all skin types97% of participants experienced an increase in moisturization immediately82% experienced an improvement in skin texture after 4 weeks of useClinically proven to maintain skin barrier over timeKey IngredientsOleic Acid and Linoleic Acid are essential fatty acids that help to regulate the skin barrierArnica & Allantoin help to soothe skinPlant-Based Ceramides help replenish the natural building blocks of your skin barrier4D Hyaluronic Acid Blend helps deliver targeted hydration to different levels of the skinMaple Sap Water helps to hydrate skin and protect the skin barrierFormulated WithoutDenatured alcoholsAdded fragranceParabensArtificial colorItem 2640130How To UseAfter cleansing, pour a few drops of Cosmic Silk into clean hands and gently press into your skin. Wait 15 seconds after dispensing before closing. Follow with the serum and moisturizer of your choice.IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, C12-C15 Alkyl Benzoate, Coconut Alkanes, Glycerin, Polyglyceryl-10 Mono/Dioleate, Polyglyceryl-3 Oleate, Phosphatidylglycerol, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Anhydroxylitol, Xylitol, Xylitylglucoside, Glucose, Euterpe Oleracea Sterols, Linoleic Acid, Linolenic Acid, Oleic Acid, Sodium Hyaluronate, Phenoxyethanol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Tocopheryl Acetate, Sorbitan Isostearate, Xanthan Gum, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate, Copolymer, Cetyl Hydroxyethylcellulose, Disodium Phosphate, Hydrated Silica, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Sodium Phosphate, Sodium Benzoate, Allantoin, Arnica Montana Flower Extract, Caprylyl Glycol, Potassium Sorbate, Hexylene Glycol, Acer Saccharum (Sugar Maple) Sap, Citric Acid, Sodium Phytate, Pentylene Glycol, Sodium Acetylated Hyaluronate, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Hydrolyzed Sodium Hyaluronate, Carbomer, Ceramide AP, Ceramide EOP, Ceramide NP, Cholesterol, Phytosphingosine, Sodium Lauroyl Lactylate.
how_to_use: After cleansing, pour a few drops of Cosmic Silk into clean hands and gently press into your skin. Wait 15 seconds after dispensing before closing. Follow with the serum and moisturizer of your choice.

reviews.headline: Nice toner
reviews.comments: The only reason I'm giving this product 4 stars instead of 5 is because if I use normal amount, it will cause little breakouts on my face. I've learned that using about 4 drops is the perfect amount for me. Leaves my skin looking silky and glowy!

reviews.headline: Best drugstore, milky toner
reviews.comments: This could rival the high end toners. If somebody would've put it in your hand and you didn't know it was not of prestige quality. You would definitely think it was. It is my favorite "drugstore" Milkey toner. It's in my top three favorite toners of all. And I have tried over 10 don't hesitate to purchase. It is awesome even for mature skin.

reviews.headline: Beware of xylitol
reviews.comments: I was so excited about this product due to all of the launch hype, only to find out it contains Xylitol which is EXTREMELY toxic to pets. This could have easily been replaced with a different hydrating ingredient. Not worth the risk of killing your pet by subconciously touching your face then touching them/their things or laying in a shared space, like on the couch, then posisoning them.

reviews.headline: glassy skin but broke me out
reviews.comments: i absolutely loved the way my skin would look and feel after using this, but unfortunately it made my acne so much worse after a month and had to stop using it üò≠

reviews.headline: So amazing !!
reviews.comments: Definitely buy this product it's super hydrating,

reviews.headline: Rhode glazing milk dupe
reviews.comments: This is an amazing milky toner! It is a great substitution for the Rhode glazing milk. This is even better becasue the packaging is so fun and innovative. I love everything about this product. It is hydrating and easy to apply to the skin. I have recommended it to everyone I know!

reviews.headline: Sooo good
reviews.comments: This is soooo similar to the Rhode Glazing Milk. It's super hydrating but isn't sticky when it dries down.

reviews.headline: Not acne safe
reviews.comments: I purchased based on others recomendation, but I broke out with new acne almost immediately after trying. "Coconut Alkines" which is pretty high on the ingredient list, is a known pore clogging ingredient. Sad because now I dont know what to do with the rest of the bottle. Waste of money.

reviews.headline: I would repurchase Once it's done
reviews.comments: Hydrating & smooth texture

reviews.headline: Just get it!!
reviews.comments:
This toner is so gentle on the skin and leavss your skin deeply hydrated and glowing!! I can't go without this under my makeup 

This is better than the Rhode Glazing milk imo

reviews.headline: Great toner
reviews.comments: I love this milky toner, it's so hydrating.

reviews.headline: in love!
reviews.comments:
ive been trying this toner out under makeup for the past month, and i'm absolutely obsessed with it! it's thick, hydrating, moisturizing, and pairs well with every foundation, skin tint, and moisturizer i've used on top of it. the milky consistency allows it to be as thick as it is while still absorbing rather quickly into the skin (i still use a fan to speed it up though). it's quickly replaced the ilia base face milk in my routine, and i'll 100% be repurchasing it once i've finished this bottle.

the only thing that i don't like about the toner is the scent. i think it's supposed to be fragrance free, but it has a strange smell to it that i don't really know how to explain. it goes away when you start rubbing it into the skin. it's just when you initially dispense it.

reviews.headline: Not worth the hype
reviews.comments: It really did nothing but break me out

reviews.headline: Terrible packaging
reviews.comments: I really like the actual toner. Its very moisturizing without being greasy. Works well under makeup. However- the packaging is horrible. Everytime I twist the bottle top to close it, a large amount of product squirts out. It makes a mess and wastes a ton of product‚Äî about three times what I would actually use on my face. Very disappointed.

reviews.headline: So good for combo skin!
reviews.comments: This toner is so good for the summer! I am combo-oily and using this toner and then a sunscreen has been a game changer. It doesn't feel heavy or thick and my skin feels good throughout the day. My only con about the product is the packaging. If you don't wait a couple of seconds before closing the tube, it just squirts out.

reviews.headline: Made me break out
reviews.comments: I loved the texture of the toner and how it felt on my skin, but sadly it made me break out!  Bubble reached out and recommend giving it 4 weeks as it may be purging, but ain't nobody got time for that.

reviews.headline: Hydration
reviews.comments: Really hydrates and works wonders under makeup

reviews.headline: Don't fall for the positive reviews
reviews.comments: I wish i had read more indepth on this product and not been influenced by their paid partners on social media because i thought hey why not? Seems like a nice product and my skin is dry. Huge, huge HUGE MISTAKE. It worked lovely for about two days then gave me the nastiest break out ive ever had in my LIFE. I have sensitive skin and saw people raving and thought to take a chance and try something new. I wish i never did. I wish i could post the pictures in this review of my skin. I'd get a pimple or two along my forhead or chin every so often but not nearly my entire face in what looks like cystic acne. It hurts and im extremly self concious about it‚Ä¶. All this mess from this one product..

reviews.headline: Bubble milky toner: sold out? NO
reviews.comments: I love this toner from it's box to the product! It's lightweight, doesn't have a strong smell, and is easy to use

reviews.headline: works but maybe not for sensitive skin
reviews.comments: i really really really wanted to love this product bc it left my skin soooooo silky smooth but after a week of using, i had the worst breakout i've ever had on my forehead and chin.

media.headline: Cosmic Silk is out of this world
I was #bubblegifted Cosmic Silk and love it!!

faceoff_positive.comments:
Alright, here's a review of Bubble Skincare's Cosmic Silk:

Bubble Skincare's Cosmic Silk moisturizer has quickly become a staple in many skincare routines, lauded for its lightweight texture and hydrating properties. Designed to cater to a variety of skin types, including sensitive and acne-prone skin, this moisturizer promises to leave your skin feeling smooth and balanced without clogging pores.

One of the standout features of Cosmic Silk is its ingredient list. It boasts a blend of skin-loving components like hyaluronic acid, known for its ability to draw moisture into the skin, and squalane, which helps to lock in hydration and support the skin's natural barrier. The inclusion of antioxidants like vitamin E further protects the skin from environmental stressors. Users appreciate that it is free from common irritants such as parabens, sulfates, and artificial fragrances, making it a safe bet for those with sensitive skin.

In terms of performance, Cosmic Silk lives up to its claims. The texture is indeed silky and absorbs quickly into the skin, leaving behind a soft, matte finish. This makes it an excellent option for daytime use, as it layers well under makeup without causing any unwanted shine or greasiness. Many users have reported a noticeable improvement in their skin's hydration levels and overall radiance after incorporating Cosmic Silk into their daily routine. It's particularly effective for those with combination skin, as it provides enough moisture to keep dry patches at bay while controlling oil production in the T-zone.

Final answer: Bubble Skincare's Cosmic Silk is a well-formulated moisturizer that delivers on its promises of hydration, balance, and a silky-smooth finish. Its lightweight texture, skin-friendly ingredients, and compatibility with various skin types make it a solid choice for anyone looking to upgrade their skincare routine.
faceoff_positive.headline: I highly recommend

faceoff_negative.comments: I have acne prone skin. the most important thing to me with skincare is obviously having products that don't break me out. this product has no scent and doesn't clog my pores, which is great! as for it doing anything? I'm not sure. I have very dewy skin as it is because I use a few, really good products consistently. maybe thats why I couldn't tell if it made a difference or not. would've given 4 stars for the fact that it's lightweight, fragrance free, and doesn't congest my pores BUT the packaging this product is in is terrible. you twist to open it to get product out, but when you twist to close it a bunch of the product shoots out and gets all over the place. this also wastes a lot of product. I've tried closing it slowly and gently shaking it to ensure there's no product at the top, but nothing stops the spit out with every single close. for this reason, I won't be re-purchasing. just ok!
faceoff_negative.headline: just ok
